meanings.definition: A person or thing that conveys or transports something.
meanings.sent1: The conveyors at the airport helped passengers move their luggage quickly.
meanings.sent2: The factory used conveyors to transport goods from one end of the building to the other.
meanings.sent3: The conveyors in the grocery store seemed to have a mind of their own, guiding customers to different aisles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted like conveyors, carrying happiness to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The image of the conveyors in the warehouse was etched in his memory, a symbol of efficiency.

meanings.definition: A mechanical device used to move materials from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The automated conveyors in the factory efficiently moved boxes along the production line.
meanings.sent2: The airport baggage claim area had conveyors that brought luggage to passengers.
meanings.sent3: The little robot pretended to be a conveyor, sliding toys from one end of the room to the other.
meanings.sent4: Time is a conveyor, constantly carrying us from one moment to the next.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the conveyors humming in the background created a rhythmic atmosphere in the warehouse.
